thread.title: Clayton Kershaw saves the day for Dodgers, sets up Game 5 vs. Mets on Thursday
thread.title_full: Clayton Kershaw saves the day for Dodgers, sets up Game 5 vs. Mets on Thursday

author: BILL PLUNKETT
title: Clayton Kershaw saves the day for Dodgers, sets up Game 5 vs. Mets on Thursday
text: Clayton Kershaw saves the day for Dodgers, sets up Game 5 vs. Mets on Thursday Oct. 13, 2015 Updated 10:52 p.m. 1 of 20 Dodgers pitcher Clayton Kershaw pumps his fist as he walks off the field at the end of the seventh inning of Tuesday's Game 4 against the Mets. FRANK FRANKLIN II, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 1 of 20 Dodgers pitcher Clayton Kershaw delivers against the Mets during the first inning. KATHY WILLENS, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 1 of 20 The Dodgers' Justin Turner follows through on a double to left field, driving in two runs against the Mets during the third inning Tuesday. FRANK FRANKLIN II, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 1 of 20 The Dodgers' Adrian Gonzalez, right, is greeted by Howie Kendrick after scoring against the Mets during the third inning Tuesday. KATHY WILLENS, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 1 of 20 Dodgers pitcher Clayton Kershaw adjusts his cap between pitches against the Mets during the first inning Tuesday. FRANK FRANKLIN II, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 1 of 20 The Mets' Lucas Duda flips his bat after striking out swinging against the Dodgers during the second inning Tuesday. KATHY WILLENS, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 1 of 20 The Mets' Wilmer Flores reacts after striking out against the Dodgers during the fifth inning. KATHY WILLENS, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 1 of 20 Dodgers first baseman Adrian Gonzalez scores on a double to left field by Justin Turner against the Mets during the third inning Tuesday. KATHY WILLENS, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 1 of 20 The Dodgers' Howie Kendrick (47) is greeted by Yasiel Puig after scoring against the Mets during the third inning Tuesday. FRANK FRANKLIN II, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 1 of 20 Dodgers first baseman Adrian Gonzalez connects for an RBI hit to center field against the Mets during the third inning. FRANK FRANKLIN II, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 1 of 20 The Dodgers' Justin Turner follows through on a double to left field, driving in two runs against the Mets during the third inning Tuesday. KATHY WILLENS, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 1 of 20 Dodgers first baseman Adrian Gonzalez and second baseman Howie Kendrick celebrate after scoring against the Mets during Game 4. RICHARD PERRY, THE NEW YORK TIMES 1 of 20 Dodgers pitcher Clayton Kershaw throws against the Mets during Game 4. CHANG W. LEE, THE NEW YORK TIMES 1 of 20 The Dodgers' Justin Turner follows through on a double to left field, driving in two runs against the Mets during the third inning. KATHY WILLENS, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 1 of 20 Mets pitcher Steven Matz delivers against the Dodgers during the first inning of Game 4 of the National League Division Series on Tuesday. FRANK FRANKLIN II, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 1 of 20 Mets pitcher Steven Matz, right, talks with David Wright after giving up a two-run double to the Dodgers' Justin Turner during the third inning. KATHY WILLENS, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 1 of 20 The Dodgers' Enrique Hernandez walks back to the dugout after striking out against the Mets during the first inning of Game 4 of the National League Division Series on Tuesday. FRANK FRANKLIN II, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 1 of 20 The Dodgers' Enrique Hernandez is greeted by teammate Justin Turner after scoring against the Mets during the third inning Tuesday. FRANK FRANKLIN II, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 1 of 20 Mets second baseman Daniel Murphy tags out the Dodgers' Enrique Hernandez on the way to turning a double play on a ground ball hit by Howie Kendrick during the seventh inning. KATHY WILLENS, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 1 of 20 Dodgers relief pitcher Kenley Jansen celebrates after getting Mets second baseman Daniel Murphy to fly out to end the eighth inning. CHANG W. LEE, THE NEW YORK TIMES
